wikipedia_page.main: James Ryan Scott (born 30 August 2000) is a Scottish professional footballer who plays as a forward for Hibernian, on loan from Championship club Hull City.

response: * James Scott (Shortland Street), character on the TV soap opera Shortland Street
* James Scott (marine) (died 1796), Sergeant of Marines in the New South Wales Marine Corps
* James Scott (Royal Navy officer) (1790–1872), British naval officer
* James Scott, 1st Duke of Monmouth (1649–1685), noble recognized by some as James II of England
* James Scott, Earl of Dalkeith (1674–1705), English nobleman and politician
*James Scott (footballer, born 2000), Scottish footballer for Motherwell
*James Scott (rugby union) (born 1999), English rugby union player

* James Scott (criminal) (born 1969), convicted of contributing to the Great Flood of 1993

* James Scott (political writer) (1733–1814), English cleric and academic, known for his "Anti-Sejanus" letters

On 21 May, Motherwell announced that Russell Griffiths, Ellis Plummer, Deimantas Petravičius, Luke Watt and Dylan King would be leaving the club at the end of their contracts, whilst Tom Aldred, Stephen Hendrie and Nadir Çiftçi would be returning to their parent clubs after their loan deals had expired. Shea Gordon, Adam Livingstone, Barry Maguire, James Scott, Peter Morrison, Jason Krones, Jordan Armstrong, Shaun Bowers and Alfredo Agyeman were all offered new contracts.
* On 31 January 2020, James Scott, of Motherwell, signed a three-and-a-half-year deal for £1.5 million. The club holding an option for a year extension.
| 31 January 2020 ||  CF ||  || James Scott ||  Motherwell || £1.5 million ||

On 31 January, Casper Sloth left Motherwell by mutual consent, Rolando Aarons joined the club on loan from Newcastle United for the remainder of the season, and James Scott moved to Hull City for an undisclosed fee.
